intro: Cicer nigrum, commonly known as black gram, is an annual legume belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical climates for its edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. Its seeds, which are rich in protein and nutrients, are used in various cuisines around the world. The plant also plays a significant role in soil enrichment due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
